channel.description: Recent content in Francesco Bez on Developer Portal

item.title: ESP-IDF tutorial series: Logging
item.description: This article shows how ESP-IDF’s logging system uses tags and verbosity levels to produce structured, configurable output, helping you keep code clean and debug more effectively.

item.title: ESP-IDF tutorial series: Errors
item.description: This article explains error handling in FreeRTOS-based embedded systems, highlighting common C practices and their limitations. It introduces ESP-IDF’s esp_err_t type and error-checking macros, demonstrating how they help manage errors systematically. It shows practical ways to implement error handling in embedded applications.

item.title: ESP-IDF Tutorials: Basic HTTP server
item.description: This article shows how to create a simple HTTP server. It explains the functions you need and the setup required. After reading this, you should be able to create your own HTTP server on Espressif devices.

item.title: Debugging with ESP-IDF VS Code extension: Part 2
item.description: This two-part guide shows how to set up VS Code with the ESP-IDF extension to debug Espressif boards using JTAG. In this second part, we will debug a simple project using gdb through Espressif’s VSCode extension. We will explore the debugging options for navigating the code and inspecting the variables.

item.title: Debugging with ESP-IDF VS Code extension: Part 1
item.description: This two-part guide shows how to set up VS Code with the ESP-IDF extension to debug Espressif boards using JTAG. This first part covers the debugging process, hardware setup and connections, and starting the openOCD server.

item.title: ESP-IDF Tutorials: Soft-AP
item.description: This tutorial guides you through setting up a soft-AP using an Espressif module and ESP-IDF. It covers the process of creating a project, configuring Wi-Fi, and handling connection events through event loops. Upon completion, you’ll be able to establish a soft-AP and manage Wi-Fi connections. It is the first step to building more advanced networking applications.
